file_insights.changes_made: Replaced absolute positioning properties (left/right) with logical properties (insetInlineStart/insetInlineEnd)
file_insights.impact: Improved RTL language support and internationalization compatibility

patterns_discovered.description: Converting physical positioning properties (left, right, top, bottom) to logical equivalents (insetInlineStart, insetInlineEnd, insetBlockStart, insetBlockEnd)
patterns_discovered.benefit: Enables automatic right-to-left (RTL) language support without code duplication

patterns_discovered.description: Absolute positioning of progress display container with flex centering
patterns_discovered.context: The component uses absolute positioning to overlay progress indicator on parent container

gotchas_discovered.description: Must ensure consistency when replacing left/right with insetInlineStart/insetInlineEnd in all similar components
insetInlineStart/insetInlineEnd are CSS Logical Properties that may require polyfills or vendor prefixes in older browsers

approach_outcome.execution_summary: Successfully migrated ProgressBar component to use CSS logical properties instead of physical positioning

recommendations.description: Review other UI components for similar left/right positioning that could benefit from logical property migration
Document the physical-to-logical property mapping for team consistency across the codebase
Verify ProgressBar renders correctly in RTL layouts after the migration
Evaluate whether top/bottom should be replaced with insetBlockStart/insetBlockEnd for complete logical property coverage
